pageContent: Those six, but its like I can get a placement in a matter of a couple of hours, right. So it behooves us not to work on all ten because one might take me 10 hours to fulfill and get paid 20 grand. The other one might take me 2 hours to fulfill and get paid 20 grand. The other one might take me 30 hours and it doesnt happen. So all things being equal okay, so I spent $50,000 and made 40 grand. Was it worth it? Sure. Its just a matter of getting more job orders. And thats kind of our bottleneck with the business is getting more trusted because theres a big level of trust there that we have to because there are some people, weve even put a lawyer on retainer for those that we make a placement for, and then they dont pay their fee. And so we just pay our guy like 20% of the placement fee to then go after the company. Of course, we dont do business with them again, but that happens probably 5% of the time.
Right.

We probably need to expand the team but that wouldnt be an issue. We know how to do that. Weve done it with our other companies and we have systems in place to expand the team pretty rapidly and its kind of a fail safe model. Just a matter of getting the leads I think would be the bottleneck.
Interesting. The other six, are you guys pretty much working for free, I guess, for.

Ten years ago I was doing cold calling and there is a certain success threshold to that. But I think the leads that were getting, if theres a method to put executives or HR managers on my calendar and I can jump on the phone and sell them over the phone that way kind of similar to how you guys got me on the phone call, Id be open to that. But in terms of doing cold outbound, I dont know, maybe I can put a team in place to do cold outbound but I dont know if thats worthwhile venture at this point. But I dont know.
Right.

Yeah, our current model is well, we kind of drink our own koolaid. If you look at me online, I run Dev Co, SEO Co, recruiters co, and so we generate leads organically through search. Thats how weve generated a vast majority of our clients over the years. And we have a handful, but wed like to grow and we know that theres methods out there like cold email marketing and then put them into some sort of drip campaign with multi channel stuff. We havent implemented those things as of yet, but were looking into it and maybe putting some sort of automation. And thats kind of what triggered me to inquire about some AI technology to automate some of those processes because Im pretty deep in the trenches with the processes right now that we have in place. So wed have to bring on some more recruiters if we wanted to go get more business. But were kind of heading that direction based upon my workload and what we want to do with the business, but right now we probably generate three to four pretty solid leads a month, which is not huge, but maybe one of those will have like four hires in the next year. So that like $100,000 worth of business for us and generated relationships with businesses over the years that come to us with three or four placements a year. So we have a handful of those, and I can fulfill on all of those. Not to say that were stagnant, but were kind of like anywhere from 900,000 to 1.2 million a year with just myself and like two other people. But were looking for ways to scale up.
